intro: Agalinis viridis, commonly known as greenstem false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its slender, green stems are covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple. The plant is often found in association with other herbaceous species in its native range.
